alert.note: Alert for Gallia; Lawrence (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 3:26PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A band of heavier rainfall impacting portions of east central Lawrence, southeastern Gallia, southeastern Lawrence, Mason, Cabell, northwestern Mingo, Putnam, Lincoln, Logan and Wayne Counties through 400 PM EST... At 324 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Gallipolis to Andy. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall of up to inch per hour. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flooding of urban, low lying and other poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Huntington, Winfield, Wayne, Hamlin, Proctorville, Beech Fork State Park, Hurricane, Barboursville, Milton, Eleanor, Buffalo, Ranger, Ona, Culloden, Harts, Gill, East Lynn Lake, Kiahsville, Dunlow and Teays Valley. This includes Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 9 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause elevated levels on small creeks and streams, and ponding of water in urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses, as well as other poor drainage areas and low lying spots. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away.
